team.name: Aaron Scherf

education.info: Concentrations in Information Communications Technology, Geographic Information Systems, and Data Science
Coursework in Economics, Machine Learning, Remote Sensing, Migration Policy, and German Language
Majors in International Business, Finance, and Economics Minors in Management and Global Development Studies

team.description: Aaron believes in the power of technology and information to unify people and change the world. His passion for housing began in Cape Town, South Africa, where he developed data solutions for a microfinance organization which helped local residents of townships protect and improve their homes. Since then he has worked to support a variety of non-profit organizations and local governments on issues of affordable housing, historic preservation, and migrant rights. Aaron has also served as a researcher in the US House of Representatives, the Centre for European Economic Research, and LandLink Analytic Services--a company he founded during his undergraduate studies at Mercer University. After graduation from UC Berkeley, Aaron plans to begin a career as a Foreign Service Officer with USAID. When he isn’t teaching data science at Cal or drafting a new financial analysis model, Aaron enjoys reading sci-fi paperbacks with a triple shot of espresso.

team.name: Ramsay Boly

education.degree: Bachelor of Conflict Analysis and Resolution

work.employer: The Trade Foundation - Blockhain Based Ethical Supply Chains Startup

team.description: Ramsay believes that social capital is a community’s most valuable resource for development and sustainability. He’s an advocate for mobilizing communities and restorative justice practices and Ramsay believes that breaking cycles of violence which define our cities requires collaboration across sectors. Ramsay’s interest in conflict resolution began in his home of Burkina Faso whose current geopolitical situation has largely been influenced by a regional history of conflict and colonialism. Ramsay’s diverse experiences include working for the Neighborhood Associates Corporation in Washington DC, seven months practicing Qi Gong meditation in Taiwan, and helping to co-found a startup which utilized blockchain technology to ensure traceability of minerals in ethical supply chains. Since starting his graduate education at UC Berkeley, Ramsay has become an active leader in the Berkeley Student Cooperative, where he is currently living in the Afro House. Ramsay loves playing and coaching soccer which he calls the ‘universal language’ that he’s used to connect with people across the globe.

team.name: Jinsu Elhance

education.info: Majoring in Cognitive Science and Data Science with an emphasis on Social Welfare, Health and Poverty.

work.employer: UC Berkeley Boalt School of Law
work.role: Machine Learning and Regulation Research Assistent

team.description: Jinsu believes that democratizing technology can empower grassroots development around the world. His passion for computing and web development has been shaped by his experiences growing up in Kenya and Wales and eventually learning how to code in the Bay Area. Beyond his studies at Cal, Jinsu has worked as a software intern for MercyCorps and served as Vice President at Codeology, a student organization dedicated to fostering mentorship and self-exploration among computer scientists. When he isn’t building out a new web layout, Jinsu is out shooting landscapes or dreaming of “tiny homes”.

team.name: Cara Wolfe

work.employer: Association of Women in Electrical Engineering & CS

team.description: Cara is passionate about combining technology with community based work. She is interested in developing technologies with a social conscience and further exploring the societal implications of technology. At UC Berkeley, she is serving in several leadership positions in computer science and STEM education student organizations as the President of Engineering for Kids, the Mentorship Coordinator for the Association of Women in Electrical Engineering & Computer Science, and the Lead Organizer of CS KickStart. When she isn’t coding or planning club events, Cara enjoys exploring “hidden places” in the Bay Area.

education.info: Majoring in Computer Science, Data Science and Business

work.employer: Cognitive Exchange - Speech and Debate Teaching in South Asia Nonprofit

education.info: Majoring in Business Administration and Environmental Economics and Policy
